sentences: Glenn Jones (born September 27, 1962 in Jacksonville, Florida) is an American R&B/soul singer.
He got his recording start in R&B in 1980 when Norman Connors featured the singer on a track, "Melancholy Fire" on his album, Take It to the Limit.
Jones toured with Connors, and in 1983 he signed a deal with RCA.
In the same year, he issued a five-track mini-album Everybody Loves a Winner that had the top 30 R&B single, "I Am Somebody".
In the same year, he issued a five-track mini-album Everybody Loves a Winner that had the top 30 R&B single, "I Am Somebody".
His first full-length album, Finesse, was released in 1984.
He started recording for his third RCA album in 1985; Take It from Me was released the following year.
He started recording for his third RCA album in 1985; Take It from Me was released the following year.
Moving to Jive in 1987, Jones scored a hit with "We've Only Just Begun" which reached No. 2 on the Billboard magazine R&B chart.
The track was the lead single from the album Glenn Jones, released in 1987.
In 1991, Jones moved to Atlantic Records.
During the same year, Jones released the album, Here I Go Again.
His album Here I Am was released in 1994 and had a minor hit with the ballad "Round and Round", which reached No. 24 on the R&B charts.
His album Here I Am was released in 1994 and had a minor hit with the ballad "Round and Round", which reached No. 24 on the R&B charts.
In 1993, British girl group Eternal covered Jones's 1990 track "Stay" and released it as their debut single, reaching No. 4 in the UK and No. 19 in the US Billboard charts.
In 1993, British girl group Eternal covered Jones's 1990 track "Stay" and released it as their debut single, reaching No. 4 in the UK and No. 19 in the US Billboard charts.
Jones released the album It's Time in 1998 and Feels Good (Peak Records) in 2002, neither of which were very successful on the charts.
